# Chord: add4 in C (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The add4 chord is a variation of the major chord, featuring the addition of the fourth note of the scale to the standard major triad. When played in the key of C, using the D shape on the guitar, this chord creates a unique and rich sound that adds color and tension to the traditional major chord structure.

## Notes and Intervals
- C (Root)
- E (Major 3rd)
- G (Perfect 5th)
- F (Added 4th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The add4 chord in C (D shape on guitar) is a versatile chord voicing that can be found in a variety of musical genres, including pop, rock, folk, and jazz. The inclusion of the added 4th note introduces complexity and tension to the chord, adding a dreamy and ethereal quality to the sound. It can create a sense of longing or introspection in a song, providing a lush and harmonically interesting texture to the music.

## Songs
1. **"Clocks" by Coldplay**: The iconic piano riff in this song features the add4 chord in C, played with a D shape on the instrument.
2. **"Blackbird" by The Beatles**: This classic Beatles track incorporates the add4 chord in C (D shape on guitar) in its intricate fingerpicking pattern.
3. **"The Scientist" by Coldplay**: Another Coldplay hit that showcases the add4 chord in C (D shape on guitar) to create a melancholic and emotive atmosphere.
